The Elder Saḷalamaṇḍapī’s Story
When Kakusandha,
the brahmin Vusīma,🔽having taken a garland of saḷa flowers,🔽I had a pavilion made.

original: Gahetvā saḷalaṁ mālaṁ,🔽maṇḍapaṁ kārayiṁ ahaṁ.🔽Tāvatiṁsagato santo,
analyzed: gahetvā sa ḷalam māla  maṇḍapam kārayim aha  santo
translated: Having gone to the Tāvatiṃsa,
I obtain the best of beds;
I outshine the other gods,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.
Whether by day or by night,
while walking or standing,
I am shaded by saḷa flowers,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.🔽In this very life,

analyzed: imasmiyā iva kappamhi  yam buddham abhipūjayi
translated: I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā saḷalamaṇḍapiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā saḷalamaṇḍapiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Saḷalamaṇḍapī recited these verses.
The Elder Saḷalamaṇḍapī’s Story is the eighth.
